How to Backup Passwords on Chrome on PC or Mac: 12 Steps 
 Home Random Browse Articles Add to This Page Add Tip Easy Ways to Help Approve Questions Review Tech Feedback Fix Spelling More Things to Try...   
 Log in / Sign up   
 Desktop Site   
 Community Tested How to Backup Passwords on Chrome on PC or Mac   
 This wikiHow teaches you how to sync all your saved online passwords between Chrome and your Google account, using a desktop internet browser. 
 10 Second Summary Edit 
 1. Sign in to Chrome with your Google account. 
2. Click the three vertical dots on the top-right. 
3. Click  Settings 
4. Click  Sync  on the Settings page. 
5. Slide the  Sync everything  switch or the  Password  switch On. 
 Steps Edit 
 Part One of Two: Signing in to Chrome with Google Edit 
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/2\/22\/Backup-Passwords-on-Chrome-on-PC-or-Mac-Step-1.jpg\/v4-460px-Backup-Passwords-on-Chrome-on-PC-or-Mac-Step-1.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/2\/22\/Backup-Passwords-on-Chrome-on-PC-or-Mac-Step-1.jpg\/v4-760px-Backup-Passwords-on-Chrome-on-PC-or-Mac-Step-1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570} 
 1 
 Open the Google Chrome app.  The Chrome icon looks like a colored circle with a blue dot at the center. You can find it in your Applications folder on a Mac, or on the Start menu on Windows.
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/9\/90\/Backup-Passwords-on-Chrome-on-PC-or-Mac-Step-2.jpg\/v4-460px-Backup-Passwords-on-Chrome-on-PC-or-Mac-Step-2.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/9\/90\/Backup-Passwords-on-Chrome-on-PC-or-Mac-Step-2.jpg\/v4-760px-Backup-Passwords-on-Chrome-on-PC-or-Mac-Step-2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":347.52747252747,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":574.17582417582} 
 2 
 Click the figurehead icon in the upper-right corner.  This button is located above the three vertical dots icon in the upper-right corner of your browser window. It will open a drop-down window.
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/7\/7e\/Backup-Passwords-on-Chrome-on-PC-or-Mac-Step-3.jpg\/v4-459px-Backup-Passwords-on-Chrome-on-PC-or-Mac-Step-3.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/7\/7e\/Backup-Passwords-on-Chrome-on-PC-or-Mac-Step-3.jpg\/v4-760px-Backup-Passwords-on-Chrome-on-PC-or-Mac-Step-3.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345.63186813187,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":571.04395604396} 
 3 
 Click the blue  Sign in to Chrome  button.  This will open Chrome's sign-in form in a new pop-up window.
 If you're already signed in, you will see your name here instead of a figurehead icon. Clicking it will open a pop-up box with your account information in it. 
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/7\/77\/Backup-Passwords-on-Chrome-on-PC-or-Mac-Step-4.jpg\/v4-459px-Backup-Passwords-on-Chrome-on-PC-or-Mac-Step-4.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/7\/77\/Backup-Passwords-on-Chrome-on-PC-or-Mac-Step-4.jpg\/v4-759px-Backup-Passwords-on-Chrome-on-PC-or-Mac-Step-4.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":343.73626373626,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":567.91208791209} 
 4 
 Enter your email address in the email field.  Use your Google email to sign in to Chrome with your account.
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/4\/4a\/Backup-Passwords-on-Chrome-on-PC-or-Mac-Step-5.jpg\/v4-459px-Backup-Passwords-on-Chrome-on-PC-or-Mac-Step-5.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/4\/4a\/Backup-Passwords-on-Chrome-on-PC-or-Mac-Step-5.jpg\/v4-759px-Backup-Passwords-on-Chrome-on-PC-or-Mac-Step-5.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":343.73626373626,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":567.91208791209} 
 5 
 Click  NEXT .  It's a blue button in the lower-right corner of the sign-in pop-up. This will take you to the password form.
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/8\/83\/Backup-Passwords-on-Chrome-on-PC-or-Mac-Step-6.jpg\/v4-460px-Backup-Passwords-on-Chrome-on-PC-or-Mac-Step-6.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/8\/83\/Backup-Passwords-on-Chrome-on-PC-or-Mac-Step-6.jpg\/v4-760px-Backup-Passwords-on-Chrome-on-PC-or-Mac-Step-6.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570} 
 6 
 Enter your account password in the password field.  It should be the same password as the one you use to log into your Google mailbox.
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/1\/1a\/Backup-Passwords-on-Chrome-on-PC-or-Mac-Step-7.jpg\/v4-460px-Backup-Passwords-on-Chrome-on-PC-or-Mac-Step-7.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/1\/1a\/Backup-Passwords-on-Chrome-on-PC-or-Mac-Step-7.jpg\/v4-760px-Backup-Passwords-on-Chrome-on-PC-or-Mac-Step-7.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570} 
 7 
 Click  NEXT .  It will sign you in to Chrome with your Google account.
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/3\/34\/Backup-Passwords-on-Chrome-on-PC-or-Mac-Step-8.jpg\/v4-460px-Backup-Passwords-on-Chrome-on-PC-or-Mac-Step-8.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/3\/34\/Backup-Passwords-on-Chrome-on-PC-or-Mac-Step-8.jpg\/v4-760px-Backup-Passwords-on-Chrome-on-PC-or-Mac-Step-8.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570} 
 8 
 Click  OK, GOT IT .  This will close the sign-in window. Your name will replace the figurehead icon in the upper-right corner of your browser.
 Advertisement 
 Part Two of Two: Enabling Password Sync Edit 
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/d\/d8\/Backup-Passwords-on-Chrome-on-PC-or-Mac-Step-9.jpg\/v4-460px-Backup-Passwords-on-Chrome-on-PC-or-Mac-Step-9.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/d\/d8\/Backup-Passwords-on-Chrome-on-PC-or-Mac-Step-9.jpg\/v4-759px-Backup-Passwords-on-Chrome-on-PC-or-Mac-Step-9.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":343.1043956044,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":566.86813186813} 
 1 
 Click the three dots icon.  This button is next to the address bar in the upper-right corner of your browser window. It will open a drop-down menu.
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/0\/02\/Backup-Passwords-on-Chrome-on-PC-or-Mac-Step-10.jpg\/v4-460px-Backup-Passwords-on-Chrome-on-PC-or-Mac-Step-10.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/0\/02\/Backup-Passwords-on-Chrome-on-PC-or-Mac-Step-10.jpg\/v4-760px-Backup-Passwords-on-Chrome-on-PC-or-Mac-Step-10.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570} 
 2 
 Click  Settings  on the menu.  It will open your Settings page in a new tab.
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/3\/3d\/Backup-Passwords-on-Chrome-on-PC-or-Mac-Step-11.jpg\/v4-459px-Backup-Passwords-on-Chrome-on-PC-or-Mac-Step-11.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/3\/3d\/Backup-Passwords-on-Chrome-on-PC-or-Mac-Step-11.jpg\/v4-759px-Backup-Passwords-on-Chrome-on-PC-or-Mac-Step-11.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":343.73626373626,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":567.91208791209} 
 3 
 Click the  Sync  button.  It's located below your name and profile picture at the top of the Settings menu. This button will open your Advanced sync settings menu.
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/e\/eb\/Backup-Passwords-on-Chrome-on-PC-or-Mac-Step-12.jpg\/v4-460px-Backup-Passwords-on-Chrome-on-PC-or-Mac-Step-12.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/e\/eb\/Backup-Passwords-on-Chrome-on-PC-or-Mac-Step-12.jpg\/v4-760px-Backup-Passwords-on-Chrome-on-PC-or-Mac-Step-12.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":341.84065934066,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":564.78021978022} 
 4 
 Slide the  Sync everything  switch to
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/2\/28\/Android7switchon.png","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/2\/28\/Android7switchon.png","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":394.28571428571,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":651.42857142857} 
position.  This will automatically sync all your personal data between Chrome and your Google account, including all your passwords saved online.
 Alternatively, you can turn  Sync everything  off, and only enable  Passwords  to sync here.
